prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with four holes on its sides Step 1: Create the base coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and -90.0, and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0937, 0.0. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch for the prism base Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Step 3: Draw the outer rectangle Draw a rectangle with its vertices at (0.0, 0.0), (0.75, 0.0), (0.75, 0.75), and (0.0, 0.75). Step 4: Draw the inner circles 1. Draw a circle with its center at (0.1875, 0.1875) and radius of 0.0375. 2. Draw a circle with its center at (0.1875, 0.5625) and radius of 0.0375. 3. Draw a circle with its center at (0.5625, 0.1875) and radius of 0.0375. 4. Draw a circle with its center at (0.5625, 0.5625) and radius of 0.0375. These circles represent the holes on the sides of the prism base. Step 5: Close the loops Ensure that all loops are closed, including the outer rectangular loop and the inner circular loops. Step 6: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 7: Transform the scaled 2D sketch to 3D Sketch Transform and adjust the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. Step 8: Extrude the 3D model from the base sketch Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0937 units in the direction of the normal and 0.0 units in the opposite direction. The sketch scale is 0.75. This will create the final 3D model. Description The final shape is a rectangular prism consisting of an outer rectangular surface and four inner circular holes, with dimensions of approximately 0.75 length, 0.0937 height, and 0.75 width.</description>
